title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 78.29 - Operation of vehicles in the air operations areas restricted
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 78.29 - Operation of vehicles in the air operations areas restricted

State Regulations

All vehicles operating in the air operations areas of the
airport shall be equipped with a functioning two-way radio capable of
communicating on the proper aeronautical frequencies and shall obtain a
clearance from the airport traffic control tower before entry thereon. Vehicles
used on a regular basis in the air operations areas of the airport shall be
painted in a manner approved by the airport operator and be equipped with an
approved amber rotating or flashing beacon on the roof or upper most point of
the vehicle. After obtaining permission of the airport operator, vehicles used
on an irregular basis in or upon the airport shall proceed directly to their
destination and shall have in operation the flashing parking
lights. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
78.29

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
